required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Choroidal Change on OCTA in Eyes With High Myopia
clinical_study.official_title: OCTA to Quantify the Parapapillary Choroidal Microvascular Changes in High Myopia

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Myopia is a global healthy concern, especially the high myopia and pathological myopia among Asian populations. However, its mechanism still remains largely unclear. Recent findings suggested choroidal changes might be related to the development of myopia. This study is to useOCT angiography (OCT-A) to investigate parapapillary choroidal microvasculature change in myopic eyes, and try to find the cause-and-effect relationship between choroidal change and the development of myopia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes of MvV area from at 10 years
primary_outcome.description: area of parapapillary choroidal microvasculature void on OCTA images

primary_outcome.time_frame: difference of MvV area in each group at baseline
primary_outcome.description: area of parapapillary choroidal microvasculature void on OCTA images

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes of MvV area at 1 years
primary_outcome.description: area of parapapillary choroidal microvasculature void on OCTA images

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes of MvV area at 3 years
primary_outcome.description: area of parapapillary choroidal microvasculature void on OCTA images

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes of MvV area at 5 years
primary_outcome.description: area of parapapillary choroidal microvasculature void on OCTA images

secondary_outcome.description: number of choroidal MvV with certain size

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and refractive power
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and refractive power

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and PPA area
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and parapapillary atrophy beta area

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and choroid thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and choroid thickness

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and RNFL thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and RNFL thickness

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and Axial length
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and Axial length

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and retinal parapapillary perfusion
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and retinal parapapillary perfusion on OCTA images.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and Macular perfusion
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient between choroidal MvV and Macular perfusion on OCTA images, Retinal parapapillary perfusion with OCTA.

intervention.description: Using non-invasive, repeatable, mature device OCTA to obtain choroidal angio-map

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Spherical equivalent measurement can be included in above 4 groups
2. Willing to be followed up in the future 10 years
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Deny to sign the patient consent, or deny to be followed
2. Evidence of cardiac, or diabetic, or CNS disease.
3. Clinically diagnosed with retinal or choroidal disease
4. Glucoma
5. Cataract or corneal disease that influence the quality of fundus OCTA image

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: After completion of the prospective observational study, we would like to share data for reasonable request from other researchers.
